articles.title: New Study Reveals How Much Neanderthal DNA Still Exists In Modern Humans - NDTV
articles.description: Recent scientific findings have revealed that Neanderthal genes compose 1 to 4 per cent of the genome of modern-day humans whose ancestors moved out of Africa.
articles.content:
Neanderthal genes compose 1% to 4% of the genome of modern-day humans. (Representational)

articles.title: Lingering effects of Neanderthal DNA found in modern humans - Phys.org
articles.description: Recent scientific discoveries have shown that Neanderthal genes comprise some 1 to 4% of the genome of present-day humans whose ancestors migrated out of Africa, but the question remained open on how much those genes are still actively influencing human trait…
